name: Bigwoo Common Bond -1 Quiz | Common Bond | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these is an Italian River?
questions.explanation:
Po.

	The Loire and Marne Rivers are in France. The Salado is in Argentina.

questions.text: Upon what surface would you normally play a sport involving a goalie, a blue line and a puck?
questions.explanation:
ice.

	The sport is (ice) hockey, of course. The puck is the rubber disk used to score goals; the blue line is part of the marking on the ice which defines the different parts of the playing area. The goalie is the heavily padded player who prevents his opponents from scoring by any means he can.

questions.text: Which character is found in the boardgame  "Clue" (US)?
questions.explanation:
Green.

	Mr. Green joins,  Col. Mustard, Ms. White,  Ms. Peacock, Professor Plum,  Ms. Scarlet in the game.

questions.text: What three letter word means anger or wrath?
questions.explanation:
Ire.

	"Irk" means to annoy or to weary someone. "Err" means to make a mistake. "Ere" means prior to or before.

questions.text: What do you call the thin membranous extension from the body of a fish?
questions.explanation:
fin.

	The fins of a fish are used for swimming and balancing.

questions.text: In the Bible who were Esther, Vashti and Jezebel?
questions.explanation:
Queens.

	Esther and Vashti were queens of Persia. Jezebel was a queen of Israel during Ahab's reign.

questions.text: What actress gained fame starring in the three Alfred Hitchcock movies, "Dial M for Murder", "To Catch a Thief", and "Rear Window"?
questions.explanation:
Grace Kelly.

	Grace Kelly became Princess Grace when she married Prince Rainier of Monaco in 1956. The actress died in a car accident in 1982.

Disney.

	Walt Disney is called a "modern Aesop". He won almost 1,000 awards during his 43 year career.

Falk.

	The New York City native, Peter Falk, made more than 65 "Columbo" tele-movies over a period of 30 years.

questions.text: What word can be added to all these words to form new ones?
questions.explanation:
Land.

	Poland, Iceland, Greenland, Ireland and Finland are all nations. Queensland is an Australian state. Graceland is Elvis Presley's famous home in Memphis, TN. Disneyland is the famous California theme park and the Falkland Islands are a British Territory off the coast of Argentina.
